Package com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.gimpact

Class GimAABBSet

java.lang.Object
com.github.antzGames.gdx.ode4j.ode.internal.gimpact.GimAABBSet
public class GimAABBSet extends Object
Tools for find overlapping objects on a scenery. These functions sort boxes for faster collision queries, using radix sort or quick sort as convenience. See \ref SORTING .
  • For using these collision routines, you must create a \ref GIM_AABB_SET by using this function : \ref gim_aabbset_alloc.
  • The GIM_AABB_SET objects must be updated on their boxes on each query, and they must be update by calling \ref gim_aabbset_update
  • Before calling collision functions, you must create a pair set with \ref GIM_CREATE_PAIR_SET
  • For finding collision pairs on a scene (common space for objects), call \ref gim_aabbset_self_intersections
  • For finding collision pairs between two box sets , call \ref gim_aabbset_box_collision
  • After using collision routines, you must destroy the pairset with \ref GIM_DESTROY_PAIR_SET
  • When the box set is no longer used, you must destroy it by calling \ref gim_aabbset_destroy
Ported to Java by Tilmann Zaeschke

    • gim_aabbset_box_collision

      public void gim_aabbset_box_collision(GimGeometry.aabb3f test_aabb, GimDynArrayInt collided)
      Finds intersections between a box and a set. Return the colliding boxes of the set Precondition: aabbset must be allocated and initialized.
      Parameters:
      test_aabb - Box for collision query
      collided - Array of GUINT elements, indices of boxes. Must be initialized before (Reserve size ~ 100)
